intro: Sauvagesia cryptothallis, commonly known as the cryptothallus sauvage, is a rare and elusive fern-like plant. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds. The plant is typically found in shaded, moist environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. Its unique morphology includes a short, creeping rhizome and reduced, clustered leaves. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a challenging species to study and cultivate.
